data.title: Alec Johnson on LinkedIn: Jack Dempsey and I appreciate the support of our entrepreneurial…
data.meta_description: Jack Dempsey and I appreciate the support of our entrepreneurial ecosystem.  Last night was just another example.  Cihan Behlivan and Garrick van Buren, thank…
data.text:
Have a business idea but haven't taken the first step? Apply to Maine Venture Fund's Startup Business Challenge, and you'll have a chance to win some money to make your idea a reality. The goal is to encourage participation and entrepreneurial thinking across all ages and stimulate the next generation of innovative Maine entrepreneurs. Business plans will be judged by a panel of Maine investors and entrepreneurs. K-8: 1st Place Prize, $1,000 and Runner-up, $500 High School: 1st Place Prize, $2,000 and Runner-up, $1,000 College: 1st Place Prize, $3,000 and Runner-up, $1,000 Open: 1st Place Prize, $8,000 and Runner-up, $2,500 https://lnkd.in/g4GYXdc8

As the needs of Oklahoma entrepreneurs have evolved over the last 25 years, so have the resources available through i2E. Our core competency is the early stage of a founder's journey. From our E3 bootcamp accelerator fostering customer discovery to the Bridge2 pre-accelerator empowering high-growth startups to the exhilarating Love’s Entrepreneur’s Cup. Discover how i2E is shaping the future for Oklahoma's brightest entrepreneurs! Learn what we can do for you by visiting i2e.org. i2E receives state support from the Oklahoma Center for the Advancement of Science and Technology (OCAST) and is an integral part of Oklahoma’s Innovation Model. #i2EImpact #OklahomaEntrepreneurship #Innovation #OCASTpartners #OCASTok #fundedbyOCAST

Mainers: Do you know anyone (including kids and teens!) who is always coming up with ideas and has an entrepreneurial spirit? Have them apply to Maine Venture Fund's Startup Business Challenge for a chance to win some money. The goal is to encourage participation and entrepreneurial thinking across all ages and stimulate the next generation of innovative Maine entrepreneurs. Business plans will be judged by a panel of Maine investors and entrepreneurs. K-8: 1st Place Prize, $1,000 and Runner-up, $500 High School: 1st Place Prize, $2,000 and Runner-up, $1,000 College: 1st Place Prize, $3,000 and Runner-up, $1,000 Open: 1st Place Prize, $8,000 and Runner-up, $2,500

Thrilled to be mentoring Cohort 14 and the next generation of entrepreneurs in the National Science Foundation (NSF) Northeast I-Corp Hub. Every great business idea needs customers to be successful. However, newly minted entrepreneurs excited by the possibilities of their new tech often overlook the importance of the customer discovery process and its value in bringing the right product to the right customer at the right time. iCorp's focus on customer discovery increases startups' chances of succeeding. Every startup should do it. Go Pod 6 - Clean Energy!

I am looking for Pitch Competitions in Utah!! Small, Medium, or Big, it doesn't matter. Please send me the ones you find or already know about. I am building a resource to share all that is happening in Utah where companies can get started! Email me at timcooley@utah.gov or post a link to it in the comments. Lots of great resources are coming, and some great ones already exist here: https://startup.utah.gov/ #StartupStateInitiative #StartupState #StartSomethingHere

You may know Village Capital for our accelerators around the world, but did you know we’re also a lab for developing, testing and sharing new tools, processes, and practices to reimagine how funding gets to early-stage, impact-driven entrepreneurs? Read Village Capital's 2023 Impact Report to discover how our team has been working to support and invest in startups, build better-connected and more equitable ecosystems, and reimagine the impact innovation space. https://bit.ly/41JXQJf

Ever caught yourself daydreaming about a startup that could potentially rewrite the rules of the game? Well, you're not alone in that league! Embarking on the journey of entrepreneurship often feels like navigating a thrilling maze of ideas, each holding the promise of reshaping destinies. However, the dilemma persists: where to start and how? Fear not! The Entrepreneurial Cell at Hansraj College offers the exact guidance you need.. ● Join our 4-week bootcamp starting March 1st, 2024, featuring a hybrid format—three weeks online and one week in-person. ● Gain access to seasoned mentors, armed with invaluable insights and expertise, poised to steer you through the labyrinth of market entry and expansion. ● Stand a chance to be incubated by our esteemed Incubation Centre, MHCIIE, paving the path for your startup to scale new heights. To all aspiring entrepreneurs, seize this golden opportunity! Connect with fellow visionaries, glean wisdom from their journeys, and engage in hands-on exercises that promise to set you on the road to success. Dropping the link, so that you can check it out too :) https://tally.so/r/wMzrrp

The journey of NIYOU, a startup born from within an Entrepreneurship class at Creighton University's Heider College of Business, exemplifies innovation and collaboration. Two students, who had never worked together, joined forces due to their complementary skills. Just one year after their initial 60-day startup sprint, they had the chance to showcase their venture at the Big East startup competition. A special shoutout to Lance Frazier for encouraging them to participate. Their entry video is nothing short of remarkable—I'm confident they're on the path to victory. The team's early members, Valery Shafack and Matthew Mandolfo, set a high bar, which was only raised with the strategic addition of Samuel Perkinson. This is a call to local businesses: supporting NIYOU means not just backing Creighton student athletes, but also enhancing your brand. NIYOU is at the forefront of fostering meaningful partnerships between local enterprises and our student athletes. Watch the video, feel the energy, and consider how you can be part of this inspiring journey. #CreightonInnovation #StudentEntrepreneurs #NIYOUJourney #OmahaBusinessSupport #HeiderBusiness #LocalPartnerships #FutureLeaders #CommunityCollaboration #InnovateOmaha

Is #ThrowbackThursday still a thing? Never mind… Don’t answer that. Instead, let’s just take a moment to do what Throwback Thursdays *used* to do for us: They gave us a moment to remember where we came from. We wouldn’t call Startup Week our roots (because before Startup Week, there was Entrepreneurship Week), but it was definitely part of our story for a long time. So even though we’ve said goodbye to Startup Week as our title, we recognize how far it got us! And don't forget to let us know what you would like to get out of Entrepreneurship Week by filling out this short survey!: https://lnkd.in/g7VmkYDS #AlaskaStartupWeek #startupweek #AlaskaEntrepreneurshipWeek #AKEW24 #entrepreneurshipweek
